Comment: Don’t give in to doomerism. This iteration of democracy may be over. And if so I say good riddance. We’re long overdue for a new and more modern constitution anyway. But it’s not all doom. These people are monstrous for everyone who isn’t rich. And the people will realize that. 170 million or so people are used to voting. We won’t so easily give that up. Fight. Because the only alternative is to die. And since that’s what they want for us anyway, what other option do we have? Fight.
Author: trekaco

Comment: Meh.  It would be in a state of superposition and won't collapse into a definite state until it is observed.   Meaning, the Democracy in the box is both dead and alive until the box is opened to reveal that it is one or the other.   On the flip side, once the collapse occurs, classical reality takes over and it remains as one or the other.   For better or worse, while this may be true of quantum mechanics, it doesn't hold well for man-made things like forms of Governemnt.
